definition: to go through/to know well/(suffix) expert/to connect/to communicate/open/to clear/classifier for letters, telegrams, phone calls etc
classifier for an activity, taken in its entirety (tirade of abuse, stint of music playing, bout of drinking etc)

pinyin: e4 xing4 tong1 huo4 peng2 zhang4

sentences.english: It's a classic case of cost-push inflation.
sentences.chinese: 这是典型的成本推动的通货膨胀。

sentences.english: The price is set in scrip.
sentences.chinese: 价格是按游戏通货计算的。

sentences.english: The rate of inflations has increased by 2%.
The government’s full-year inflation target is 3 percent.
sentences.chinese: 中国政府全年的通货膨胀率目标为3%。

sentences.english: Traditional schoolbook says inflation will cause devaluation.
sentences.chinese: 传统的教科书说通货膨胀将导致货币贬值。

sentences.english: Deflation can be long-lasting and have a chilling effect on stock markets.
sentences.chinese: 通货紧缩可能会持续很长时间，给股市浇上一盆冷水。

sentences.english: The value of money lessens during inflation.
sentences.chinese: 通货膨涨期间货币贬值。

sentences.english: THE bubble that caused a global recession has been a long time deflating.
sentences.chinese: 引发全球经济衰退的泡沫就是长期的通货紧缩。

sentences.english: This amount increases each year you're here in-line with inflation and subject to government regulations.
sentences.chinese: 这个数字每年会随着通货膨胀率变化而变化。

sentences.english: Sometimes inflation may rise from causes dissociated from money.
sentences.chinese: 有时候通货膨胀可能由兴钱无关的原因引起。

sentences.english: Instead, inflation is turning out to be a potentially thornier problem.
sentences.chinese: 然而现在通货膨胀正在变成一个更严峻的潜在问题。

sentences.english: But one of the side effects of all that liquidity in the markets was inflation.
sentences.chinese: 但是，市场流动性所带来的另一个效果就是通货膨胀。
经济有通货膨胀的趋势。
通货膨胀使物价节节上涨。

sentences.english: What do investors do when the government sounds a warning about inflation?
sentences.chinese: 政府对通货膨胀发出警告之际，投资者该怎么做？

sentences.english: The new Major is made a charge against failure to fulfill his promise on lowing the Inflation Rate.
sentences.chinese: 新市长被指控未能履行降低通货膨胀率的承诺。

definition: local currency/our own currency/abbr. to 本幣|本币
Fabi, first currency issued by the 國民黨|国民党[Guo2 min2 dang3] in 1935, in use until 1948
local currency/our own currency/abbr. for 本位貨幣|本位货币

pinyin: e4 xing4 tong1 huo4 peng2 zhang4

definition: currency issued by Nationalist Government in 1948
currency issued by Nationalist Government in 1948
